intro: Pelargonium microphyllum, commonly known as the miniature geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its compact size and vibrant blooms. Pelargonium microphyllum is also valued for its use in horticulture and as a source of essential oils.
